text.__SUMMARY__: Gymnopilus lepidotus is a species of mushroom in the Cortinariaceae family.
text.Description:
The cap is 0.4 to 0.8 centimetres (0.2 to 0.3 in) in diameter.
Microscopic characteristics
text.Habitat and distribution: Gymnopilus lepidotus grows on gum logs in Florida, in July.
text.Phylogeny: This species is in the lepidotus-subearlei grouping.
